get.summary: List sqlManagedInstance resources in the subscription

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the Azure subscription

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the request

items.description: A SqlManagedInstance.

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

default.description: The kubernetes scheduling options. It describes restrictions used to help Kubernetes select appropriate nodes to host the database service

resources.description: The kubernetes resource limits and requests used to restrict or reserve resource usage.

requests.description: Requests for a kubernetes resource type (e.g 'cpu', 'memory'). The 'cpu' request must be less than or equal to 'cpu' limit. Default 'cpu' is 2, minimum is 1. Default 'memory' is '4Gi', minimum is '2Gi. If sku.tier is GeneralPurpose, maximum 'cpu' is 24 and maximum 'memory' is '128Gi'.

limits.description: Limits for a kubernetes resource type (e.g 'cpu', 'memory'). The 'cpu' request must be less than or equal to 'cpu' limit. Default 'cpu' is 2, minimum is 1. Default 'memory' is '4Gi', minimum is '2Gi. If sku.tier is GeneralPurpose, maximum 'cpu' is 24 and maximum 'memory' is '128Gi'.

replicas.description: This option specifies the number of SQL Managed Instance replicas that will be deployed in your Kubernetes cluster for high availability purposes. If sku.tier is BusinessCritical, allowed values are '2' or '3' with default of '3'. If sku.tier is GeneralPurpose, replicas must be '1'.

keytabSecret.description: Keytab secret used to authenticate with Active Directory.

mode.description: Transparent data encryption mode. Can be Service Managed, Customer managed or disabled

protectorSecret.description: Protector secret for customer managed Transparent data encryption mode

forceencryption.description: If 1, then SQL Server forces all connections to be encrypted. By default, this option is 0

tlsciphers.description: Specifies which ciphers are allowed by SQL Server for TLS

tlsprotocols.description: A comma-separated list of which TLS protocols are allowed by SQL Server

basicLoginInformation.description: Username and password for basic authentication.

lastUploadedDate.description: Last uploaded date from Kubernetes cluster. Defaults to current date time

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the Arc-enabled SQL Managed Instance resource.

activeDirectoryInformation.description: Active Directory information related to this SQL Managed Instance.

keytabInformation.description: Keytab information that is used for the Sql Managed Instance when Active Directory authentication is used.

licenseType.description: The license type to apply for this managed instance.

clusterId.description: If a CustomLocation is provided, this contains the ARM id of the connected cluster the custom location belongs to.

extensionId.description: If a CustomLocation is provided, this contains the ARM id of the extension the custom location belongs to.

name.description: The name of the extended location.

type.description: The type of the extended location.

tier.description: The pricing tier for the instance.

dev.description: Whether dev/test is enabled. When the dev field is set to true, the resource is used for dev/test purpose.

size.description: The SKU size. When the name field is the combination of tier and some other value, this would be the standalone code.

family.description: The SKU family

capacity.description: The SKU capacity

nextLink.description: Link to retrieve next page of results.

partnerManagedInstanceId.description: The resource ID of the partner SQL managed instance.

spec.description: The specifications of the failover group resource.

sharedName.description: The shared name of the failover group for this SQL managed instance. Both SQL managed instance and its partner have to use the same shared name.

startTime.description: The start time for the time range to fetch telemetry for. If not specified, the current time minus 1 hour is used.

endTime.description: The end time for the time range to fetch telemetry for. If not specified, the current time is used.

interval.description: The time granularity to fetch telemetry for. This is an ISO8601 duration. Examples: PT15M, PT1H, P1D

aggregationType.description: The aggregation type to use for the numerical columns in the dataset.

databaseNames.description: The list of database names to return telemetry for. If not specified, telemetry for all databases will be aggregated and returned.

parameters.description: The API version to use for the request

schema.description: A section of the telemetry response for the SQL Server instance.

items.description: The telemetry column for the SQL Server instance.

name.description: The name of the telemetry column.

type.description: The type of the telemetry column.

rows.description: A list of rows from the result telemetry table for the SQL Server instance.

items.description: An array of values representing a telemetry row for the SQL Server instance.

nextLink.description: The link to the next section of rows of the telemetry response for the SQL Server instance. Null if no more sections are available.

202.description: Arc SQL Server telemetry retrieval is in progress.

Location.description: The URL to retrieve the operation status.

parameters.description: The request body for availability group resource.

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

properties.description: Properties of Arc Sql Server availability group

availabilityGroupId.description: ID GUID of the availability group.

collectionTimestamp.description: Timestamp for when the data was collected from the client machine.

failureConditionLevel.description: User-defined failure condition level under which an automatic failover must be triggered.

healthCheckTimeout.description: Wait time (in milliseconds) for the sp_server_diagnostics system stored procedure to return server-health information, before the server instance is assumed to be slow or not responding.

automatedBackupPreferenceDescription.description: Preferred location for performing backups on the availability databases in this availability group.

version.description: SQL Server availability group current version.

basicFeatures.description: Specifies whether this is a basic availability group.

dtcSupport.description: Specifies whether DTC support has been enabled for this availability group.

dbFailover.description: Specifies whether the availability group supports failover for database health conditions.

isDistributed.description: Specifies whether this is a distributed availability group.

clusterTypeDescription.description: SQL Server availability group cluster type description

requiredSynchronizedSecondariesToCommit.description: The number of secondary replicas that must be in a synchronized state for a commit to complete.

isContained.description: SQL Server availability group contained system databases.

primaryReplica.description: Name of the server instance that is hosting the current primary replica.

primaryRecoveryHealthDescription.description: Indicates the recovery health of the primary replica.

secondaryRecoveryHealthDescription.description: Indicates the recovery health of a secondary replica.

synchronizationHealthDescription.description: Reflects a roll-up of the synchronization health of all availability replicas in the availability group.

replicas.description: A list of Availability Group Replicas.

items.description: The properties of Arc Sql availability group replica resource

replicaId.description: ID GUID of the availability group.

endpointUrl.description: Mirroring endpoint URL of availability group replica

availabilityModeDescription.description: The Availability Synchronization mode of the availability group replica.

failoverModeDescription.description: The failover mode of the availability group replica.

sessionTimeout.description: The time-out period of availability group session replica, in seconds.

primaryRoleAllowConnectionsDescription.description: Whether the availability allows all connections or only read-write connections.

secondaryRoleAllowConnectionsDescription.description: Whether an availability replica that is performing the secondary role (that is, a secondary replica) can accept connections from clients.

replicaCreateDate.description: Date that the replica was created.

replicaModifyDate.description: Date that the replica was modified.

backupPriority.description: Represents the user-specified priority for performing backups on this replica relative to the other replicas in the same availability group.

readOnlyRoutingUrl.description: Connectivity endpoint (URL) of the read only availability replica.

readWriteRoutingUrl.description: Connectivity endpoint (URL) of the read write availability replica.

availabilityGroupReplicaRole.description: Current Always On availability groups role of the availability group replica.

operationalStateDescription.description: Current operational state of the availability group replica

recoveryHealthDescription.description: Recovery health of the availability group replica.

synchronizationHealthDescription.description: Reflects a rollup of the database synchronization state (synchronization_state) of all joined availability databases (also known as replicas) and the availability mode of the replica (synchronous-commit or asynchronous-commit mode). The rollup will reflect the least healthy accumulated state the databases on the replica.

connectedStateDescription.description: Whether a secondary replica is currently connected to the primary replica.

lastConnectErrorDescription.description: Text description of the last connection error of the availability group replica.

lastConnectErrorTimestamp.description: Date and time timestamp indicating when the last connect error occurred.

nextLink.description: Link to retrieve next page of results.

databases.description: A list of Availability Group Database Replicas.

value.description: Array of Availability Group Database Replicas.

items.description: The properties of Arc Sql availability group database replica resource

isLocal.description: Whether the availability database is local.

isPrimaryReplica.description: Returns 1 if the replica is primary, or 0 if it is a secondary replica.

isCommitParticipant.description: Whether this replica is transaction committer.

synchronizationHealthDescription.description: Description of the health of database.

databaseStateDescription.description: Description of the database state of the availability replica.

isSuspended.description: Whether this data movement is suspended.

suspendReasonDescription.description: Description of the database suspended state reason.

nextLink.description: Link to retrieve next page of results.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the Arc-enabled SQL Server availability group resource.

requests.description: Requests for a kubernetes resource type (e.g 'cpu', 'memory'). The 'cpu' request must be less than or equal to 'cpu' limit. Default 'cpu' is 2, minimum is 1. Default 'memory' is '4Gi', minimum is '2Gi. If sku.tier is GeneralPurpose, maximum 'cpu' is 24 and maximum 'memory' is '128Gi'.

limits.description: Limits for a kubernetes resource type (e.g 'cpu', 'memory'). The 'cpu' request must be less than or equal to 'cpu' limit. Default 'cpu' is 2, minimum is 1. Default 'memory' is '4Gi', minimum is '2Gi. If sku.tier is GeneralPurpose, maximum 'cpu' is 24 and maximum 'memory' is '128Gi'.

replicas.description: This option specifies the number of SQL Managed Instance replicas that will be deployed in your Kubernetes cluster for high availability purposes. If sku.tier is BusinessCritical, allowed values are '2' or '3' with default of '3'. If sku.tier is GeneralPurpose, replicas must be '1'.

keytabSecret.description: Keytab secret used to authenticate with Active Directory.

mode.description: Transparent data encryption mode. Can be Service Managed, Customer managed or disabled

protectorSecret.description: Protector secret for customer managed Transparent data encryption mode

forceencryption.description: If 1, then SQL Server forces all connections to be encrypted. By default, this option is 0

tlsprotocols.description: A comma-separated list of which TLS protocols are allowed by SQL Server

isDistributed.description: Specifies whether this is a distributed availability group.

clusterTypeDescription.description: SQL Server availability group cluster type description

isContained.description: SQL Server availability group contained system databases.

primaryReplica.description: Name of the server instance that is hosting the current primary replica.

items.description: The properties of Arc Sql availability group replica resource

replicaId.description: ID GUID of the availability group.

endpointUrl.description: Mirroring endpoint URL of availability group replica

availabilityModeDescription.description: The Availability Synchronization mode of the availability group replica.

failoverModeDescription.description: The failover mode of the availability group replica.

sessionTimeout.description: The time-out period of availability group session replica, in seconds.

primaryRoleAllowConnectionsDescription.description: Whether the availability allows all connections or only read-write connections.

secondaryRoleAllowConnectionsDescription.description: Whether an availability replica that is performing the secondary role (that is, a secondary replica) can accept connections from clients.

replicaCreateDate.description: Date that the replica was created.

replicaModifyDate.description: Date that the replica was modified.

backupPriority.description: Represents the user-specified priority for performing backups on this replica relative to the other replicas in the same availability group.

readOnlyRoutingUrl.description: Connectivity endpoint (URL) of the read only availability replica.

readWriteRoutingUrl.description: Connectivity endpoint (URL) of the read write availability replica.

availabilityGroupReplicaRole.description: Current Always On availability groups role of the availability group replica.

operationalStateDescription.description: Current operational state of the availability group replica

recoveryHealthDescription.description: Recovery health of the availability group replica.

synchronizationHealthDescription.description: Reflects a rollup of the database synchronization state (synchronization_state) of all joined availability databases (also known as replicas) and the availability mode of the replica (synchronous-commit or asynchronous-commit mode). The rollup will reflect the least healthy accumulated state the databases on the replica.

connectedStateDescription.description: Whether a secondary replica is currently connected to the primary replica.

lastConnectErrorDescription.description: Text description of the last connection error of the availability group replica.

lastConnectErrorTimestamp.description: Date and time timestamp indicating when the last connect error occurred.

SqlServerInstanceTelemetryRequest.description: The Arc SQL Server instance telemetry retrieval request.

datasetName.description: The name of the telemetry dataset to retrieve.

startTime.description: The start time for the time range to fetch telemetry for. If not specified, the current time minus 1 hour is used.

endTime.description: The end time for the time range to fetch telemetry for. If not specified, the current time is used.

interval.description: The time granularity to fetch telemetry for. This is an ISO8601 duration. Examples: PT15M, PT1H, P1D

aggregationType.description: The aggregation type to use for the numerical columns in the dataset.

databaseNames.description: The list of database names to return telemetry for. If not specified, telemetry for all databases will be aggregated and returned.

SqlServerInstanceTelemetryColumn.description: The telemetry column for the SQL Server instance.

name.description: The name of the telemetry column.

type.description: The type of the telemetry column.

SqlServerInstanceTelemetryRow.description: An array of values representing a telemetry row for the SQL Server instance.

SqlServerInstanceTelemetryResponse.description: A section of the telemetry response for the SQL Server instance.

columns.description: The columns of the result telemetry table for the SQL Server instance.

items.description: The telemetry column for the SQL Server instance.

name.description: The name of the telemetry column.

type.description: The type of the telemetry column.

rows.description: A list of rows from the result telemetry table for the SQL Server instance.

items.description: An array of values representing a telemetry row for the SQL Server instance.

nextLink.description: The link to the next section of rows of the telemetry response for the SQL Server instance. Null if no more sections are available.
